This year, Marching band is a little different. Here is what you need to know for the next two weeks if you are in marching band:

Percussion Bootcamp is July 30- August 1st, 5:30pm-8:30pm.

Section leader meeting will be July 31 6pm-7:30pm

Due to social distancing implemented in the school plan, we will be altering the band camp schedule. August 3-7
Every day, 7am-9am the full band will be meeting outside for rehearsals. 9am-11am will change for specific sections to say.

M: 7-9 All; 9-11 Woodwinds
T: 7-9 All; 9-11 Brass
W: 7-9 All: 9-11 Percussion
Th: 7-9 All; 9-11 Woodwinds
F: 7-9 All; 9-11 Brass

If there is bad weather, the 7-9 full band will be canceled. However, that group meeting 9-11 will still meet. ( Example: Rain Wednesday = only 9-11 percussion )

Looking forward to a great season!

Congratulations Coach Center, New Bloomfield Varsity Girls Basketball Coach 2020-2021

I have taught and been an assistant coach for track here at New Bloomfield for the past seven years. In my time as a track coach we have had 13 all-state events, including one state championship in the 4x400m relay for the class 2 boys. Our boys team placed 5th in the state in 2018 and missed 4th by two points. Our team won a district championship in 2018 and we were the runner up in 2017.

I played basketball through high school and college at the Division II level. I have coached at every level from middle school to varsity. Most recently I have been coaching through my business where I have worked with many local athletes helping to develop their basketball skills.

My wife, Erin, and I have been married for eight years and have a baby girl, Coraline, who is 8 months old.

I am excited for the opportunity and looking forward to getting to work.

Welcome, Mrs. Kaestner!

Hailee Kaestner will serve her first year teaching as the Head Music Director of New Bloomfield High School and Middle School. Originally from St. Louis, her student teaching experience was held in the Fort Zumwalt School District where she worked with the North High School concert and marching band, North Middle School bands, and J.L. Mudd K-2 Elementary music. She comes with her Bachelors of Music Education from Missouri State University where she participated in the PRIDE Marching Band, Wind Symphony, Brass and Sass Band, and the Professional Music Fraternity Mu Phi Epsilon. During this time, she also was Head Music Director of Seventh Day Adventist Jr Academy from 2017-2019 where she ran the band program and started the school’s first ever choir. Her passion for music and teaching brings her down to New Bloomfield, leaving her large family in St. Louis to start her journey as an educator with much excitement and enthusiasm for the upcoming school year.
